name: Langham Place, Fifth Avenue

reviews.text: We chose to stay at the Setai based on the good reviews it received. Unfortunately we did not have the same good experience. We stayed there for a week and left feeling very let down. We had the classic package that included full american breakfast. On arrival the reception staff told us that they did not have that on their system. I forwarded the email confirming we had breakfast included in the rate and the receptionist said he would send us the breakfast vouchers. What he actually sent me were vouchers for continental breakfast which is of a lower value. I had to call again to set this issue clear and finally get the correct vouchers. Unlike other hotels were they offer the most generous breakfasts at the Setai they are extremely stingy. Full breakfast to them is 2 eggs, 1 sausage, coffee and 1 Juice. For anything else you get charged extra. The free wifi is extremely slow we paid the 15 dollar extra per day. They have all the disney channels apart from Disney Junior, so that they can charge 3.99 or something for 30 minute shows for pre-schoolers. We were never told of the courtesy car they have - they never offered it to us. The room was not being cleaned thoroughly. They change sheets every 3 days. My son had smudged the floor to ceiling mirror in the closet area, those smudges stayed there for 3 days. The doormen would see us coming in with children and bags in arms - would take them quite some time to come and help us. Every night I had to deal with the cigarette smoke from the room next to us. A lot of smoke!!! The positives of the hotel were the size of the rooms, the room service food and the location.
reviews.title: Should have stayed elsewhere

reviews.text: I booked a one-bedroom suite for 2 nights at the Setai fifth avenue. I chose this hotel because it is branded as a five stars hotel, because of the flexible check-in and checkout times and finally because of the good reviews on this website. Unfortunately, even though there were positives during my stay at the Setai, it did not reach my expectations for many reasons.
reviews.title: Very good, but expected more from this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I’ll start with the negatives.
reviews.title: The case of the Hungry Housekeeper

reviews.text: First, they pretend on their website that the hotel has flexible check-in and checkout times. In the hotel’s guide inside my suite, it’s also clearly written that «there’s no check in and checkout times at the Setai» and that guests can request a late checkout for their date of departure. Unfortunately, this is not true. I booked this hotel for this reason because I was landing in New-York in early afternoon and leaving in the evening and I didn’t want to wait hours at the hotel bar to wait for check in. Well, that’s exactly what happened. I arrived at the hotel just before 1h00PM and they told me at the reception I had to wait until 2h30PM for my suite to be ready. No excuses, no upgrades. At 2h15, the front desk clerk reached me at the bar to tell me my suite was ready. That was a nice touch, but I was expecting my room to be ready when I arrived. Same story for checking out. I asked the front desk the day before my departure for a late checkout. They asked me what time, and when I said 6h00PM, they said it was impossible and the best they could do for me was 2h00PM. That’s unacceptable from a hotel that clearly claims they have no check-in and checkout times.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice on 5th Avenue
Enjoyed it more this time but $40 for a Belgium waffle. Really??
reviews.text: The other negative is that I requested at the time of booking a high floor because I always like to have nice views when I book hotels. They gave me the 19th floor. I could say it is a high floor, but not in this case since their website says the hotel’s one bedroom suites are located between 18th and 27th floor.

Just got back and really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are exceptionally large and the bed was extremely comfortable. Staff very helpful. They are very flexible with late check out. Looking forward to going back.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: General:
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: stylish and modern hotel in great location
reviews.title: Beautiful apartments ...but unprofessional service...

reviews.text: Location:
reviews.title: Mixed feelings: not as good as the hype but not totally bad and def worth a stay

reviews.text: great location on 5th Avenue, only minutes away from Empire State Building
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were welcomed in a genuine and thoughtful way. Among the pleasures of the hotel was an espresso machine with all the fixings in the room. The room was lovely and we emptied the espresso supplies-delicious. The next day we left around 9am for a day of sightseeing in the city. We had a wonderful day and returned around 3:30 for another round of espresso's and a nap before dinner and a play. The day was rainy and as we walked a great deal we were soaked. So a hot shower, espresso and a nap. However, the room was not made up. By the time it was there was no time for any of the planned rest before dinner. When the room was finally made up the espresso supplies were not replenished nor were they resupplied at turn down service. Reading the ratings in more detail I see this is not a rare occurrence. The staff apologized but no explanation was given. I think the saying is you only have one time to make a good first impression. At a less exclusive property no big deal but in hundreds of stays at hotels this had only happened to me once before and not at a high end property.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Luxury with a personal touch
reviews.text: We had an amazing experience from start to finish. The hospitality throughout is unsurpassed. We enjoyed all the extras great espresso in the room, complimentary refreshments in the fridge, amazing dark chocolate, housekeeping with pressing of 5 pieces of clothing daily, and complimentary shoeshine and newspaper of your choice. There is also no set check out time so you can leisurely utilize your room until your departure time. Our room 1011 had a great view of the Empire State Building and the bedding and shower were fantastic. Also the car service is awesome. Anytime you can ride in a Maserati you're having a good day and the driver Jack was great. If you can afford it I would highly recommend. Thank you Setai for making our stay a perfect memory. We will be back! Also a special thank you to our personal assistant Narissa she went out of her way to make my wife and I anniversary amazing.
I'm not sure what a boutique hotel is anymore, but the Setai Fifth Avenue must surely rank as one. I was there on business but it would be a great hotel for couples who are exploring NY.
reviews.title: Chic and modern

reviews.text: The lobby area is small but with very clean lines and a minimal feel to it. The service throughout the hotel is faultless. The rooms are small but again perfectly appointed for a luxury hotel. Don't expect a view you'll be overlooking another building, but hey when all's said and done you're in NY, very few hotels have a view. I miss the Plaza for that!
reviews.title: My favourite hotel in my life

reviews.text: The bar area is ok, but again small and will get very busy. Even as a resident you'll need to be lucky to get a seat during the early evening.
reviews.title: Could do better....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we recently stayed for a week in early june, huge dispointment. first they put as in a tiny room with view to a construccion site. after speaking to the receptionist they moved us to a betterwroom, without view but at least it had a decent size. the breakfast was terrible, we had dinner at their restaurant one night and the food was not good. the location is good and the people who work there is very nice, but i can not see it as a five star hotel. i can not understand all the praises.
reviews.title: Disapointed!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful hotel. The personal assistants will make certan that all of your requests are taken care of. The beds are not my favorites as they are low to the floor and at times a bit uncomfortable.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: t
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Setai in early June. We treated ourselves to a really lovely hotel and we were not disappointed. Everything about this hotel were great - the room was big, the bed comfy, the service was outstanding, the food was good and was in a great location. It was our first time in NYC so we wanted to do all the touristy things and this was a great base. Can't recommend this hotel highly enough.
reviews.title: Pleased with my choice!

reviews.text: Well I wasn't 100% sure about booking the Setai. Our default hotels are usually the Four Seasons and the Mandarin Oriental and despite the high rating on TA I was unsure about an unknown hotel. I shouldn't have worried.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel Unique Find in NYC

reviews.text: Magnificent hotel with professional and friendly staff. As we were staying 7 nights they upgraded us to a bigger room.
reviews.title: Magnificent hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The very large bed was extremely comfortable and the same with the pillows.
reviews.title: We love this property!

reviews.text: The Nespresso machine, the complimentary drinks and water in the room all free of charge were a lovely touch.
reviews.title: Things you don't expect to hear at a Five Star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free wi-fi was excellent too.
reviews.title: Th place to stay while in NYC.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location within walking distance of Empire State Building, Times Square, theaters, etc. is just terrific.
reviews.title: Second stay at the Setai

reviews.text: We stayed at Setai last month and were truly disappointed several times during our stay.
reviews.title: Definitely not a 5 star hotel or experience

reviews.text: The location is great for walking to times square and shopping districts. The rooms are large for NY standards, but carpets are off white and very dirty with stains, poor choice for colors or needs carpet cleaning services.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: Their concierge/personal assistant service is great in concept but not in reality. We had several negative experiences with the concierge. We ordered tickets for empire state building and they charged us twice for the tickets. As well, we order statue of liberty tickets and were charged twice for those as well. The worst situation is when we sent a bag to our room from shopping and the bag mysteriously disappeared! Security did a good job to show us how several parties(about 6 different times) had gone in and out of our room during the day (while we were out). After we complained and asked to speak with hotel manager we were told he would talk tu us After his meeting, and after waiting 2 hours without any contact we had to force the issue at front desk! Finally I had to make a suggestion for the hotel to take the measly $200 of missing or stolen merchandise off our $6000 bill!!!! Very poor customer service that a hotel manager could not have handled this serious situation and made an offer of compensation, which would have made them look better and like they care about their customer and reputation. Made us wait and wait and didn't have the courtesy to see us in person or call our room, very poor and inexperienced management team. Any decent hotel would have credited a night or offered some form of a future credit weekend to encourage more business, unfortunately I am better at customer service then they are, and I have nothing to do with hospitality business. We stayed at a hotel in June that was 3 star (no choice) and they forgot to clean room, so manager took $100 off a $200 room for not cleaning room!!!
reviews.title: The best NYC has to offer

reviews.text: As well their maserati car service is never available as its always in the garage, so false advertising for that service. we also arranged a car to Brooklyn and they charged us $350 which is absolutely outrageous and it wasn't anything fancy! All other car services were charging $65 to $85 for the same service, I feel robbed by this ripoff.
reviews.title: I highly recommend the Setai, but still a few negative moments to mention

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also we had a major miscommunication one night over dinner late at night for our family which we were misdirected to wrong address and type of restaurant which ended up being closed. They need to train their concierge staff to know the city better and call ahead for restaurants.
reviews.title: Skip the Setai

reviews.text: The Setai Hotel in NYC was one of the best hotels I have eve stayed at. I was upgraded to an apt suite which was 1200 sq feet; it was a piece of heaven in NY where rooms can be the size of a small bathroom. Staff was attentive and friendly- no pretense here just great customer service.
reviews.title: THE BEST NYC has to offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't usually say this about many hotels but The Setai was perfect. Service at its best without an attitude found at other 5 star hotels.
reviews.title: A good choice but not quite great

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night before a cruise and strictly on the merits of TripAdvisor reviews. Beautiful hotel with large comfortable rooms for NYC. Loved the bar area with great bar food and drinks (although at $16 for cocktails, it is no bargain). The only issue we had was with the Dux bed would you believe. I have never slept on one and was excited that this was a feature of the hotel. It is basically a box spring with a thick mattress pad. Not exactly the cloud 9 experience we were expecting. But other than that, the room was very modern with a wonderful bathroom and high tech features. Another real bonus was the free mini bar amenities including a wonderful coffee machine and free bottled water. The price point here is definitely on the high end but the staff makes you feel welcomed and comfortable.
reviews.title: 1st class service!

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 days in a 1 bdm suite. The service is out of this world. Weve stayed in several five star resorts but the service does not compete. Personal assistant offered to run to the store for a few things we needed for the say! Amazing experience!
reviews.title: Always surprised

reviews.text: I have now stayed at this hotel four times, over the last 9 months and frankly I cannot believe the consistency of the experience or the service from the doormen to the front desk to the staff you meet in the hallways as they go about their tasks...if they keep this up the downside is one will never be able to get in....they have it down, this is what staying in a great hotel in a great city should be about....just keep it to yourself...
reviews.title: Service at its best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from 4 night stay at The Setai. Upon arrival all the staff including the bell hops, concierge, and reception were so friendly, and accomodating - and all had the best attitude. Every staff person had a huge smile on their face and many would greet us by our names.
reviews.title: FABULOUS HOTEL!

reviews.text: We had a beautiful studio suite, which was very spacious with modern decor. The bedding including the sheets and pillows were all the finest. The bathrooms were wonderful with double sinks, lots of counter space and a TV in the mirror. The bathroom towels were very luxurious! The walk in shower was very large and the soaking tub was gigantic! I have never been in a hotel with so much closet and storage space. There were drawers everywhere. The refrigerator was filled with complimentary drinks and at turn down there were treats including cookies and popcorn. There were large picture windows in the living area and also the bathroom. Their were 2 other flat screen televisons - 1 across from the bed, and another one in the sitting area. The lighting in the room was excellent. The housekeeping staff cleaned our rooms 2x a day to perfection!
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were impressed with everything the hotel had to offer. The bar was a great place for a drink and had jazz music nightly.If you are looking for a Fabulous hotel in a great location this is the hotel for you. The managers of the hotel should be proud of all their staff for making our stay so special.
reviews.title: Huge disappointment: go elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was nervous about my trip to New York - my first trip to America, and bringing my two teenage children. However, when we arrived at the Setai, any concerns were allayed as we were greeted by the very courteous Brett who whisked our cases in from the taxi almost before they hit the pavement. He gave us a tour, yes literally, of our room - a double Queen bedded suite with a hallway, dressing area and magnificent bathroom. The bedroom was a very comfortably large area with amply stocked minibar ie with complimentary soft drinks which was kept well stocked throughout out our stay. The room was very well serviced twice a day, was always very clean, everything neatly arranged or folded, and cookies left each afternoon etc. Nothing was too much trouble. The room looked over 5th Avenue and we were never bothered by other guest noise at night - evening traffic noise was not intrusive. The beds were very comfortable. The bar provided very good food in the evening. I particularly liked the security - there was always someone greeting you at the entrance. The lifts required a card swipe to take you to your floor which made me feel very safe with my children.
reviews.title: Anniversary Gone Wrong!

reviews.text: The location I thought was amazing. Two blocks from the Empire State building and a walk up 5th Avenue offers fabulous shops, the Public Library - do go in it is beautiful, Bryant Park, the Rockefeller Centre, Trump Tower, and after 20 minutes Central Park. Handy also for Central Station which is also lovely. Two minutes South brings you onto 34th Street for more shopping.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay at the Setai

description: Gracefully complementing Manhattan’s luxurious Fifth Avenue and boldly accenting New York City’s famous skyline, Langham Place Fifth Avenue is a renewed celebration of sophistication and style. Soaring more than sixty stories above the city, Langham Place, Fifth Avenue represents the new heart of the world’s most inspired metropolis. Accommodations exude the very essence of luxury and elegance. Duxiana beds, Pratesi linens, and floor-to-ceiling rain showers leave guests breathing easy, if not breathless.
